subhead: The killing of 20-year-old Mehdi Kessaci drew thousands into the streets, where his brother Amine, a well-known local figure in the fight against the devastation caused by drug trafficking, told the crowd: 'For years we have been raising the alarm… silence kills.'

title: How the US tried to undermine the G20 summit in South Africa
subhead: Washington is boycotting the event taking place on Saturday and Sunday in Johannesburg. Yet despite intimidation from the Trump administration, South Africa has pushed ahead with its agenda, placing the priorities of developing countries at the heart of the summit – the first G20 ever held in Africa.

title: Brazil's ex-leader Bolsonaro taken into custody over flight risk
subhead: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the pre-emptive arrest of the former president on Saturday, after a judge said he was preparing to flee just days before starting his 27-year sentence for leading an attempted coup.

title: Ukraine faces US ultimatum to accept a lopsided 'peace plan'
subhead: Donald Trump has given Kyiv until November 27 to agree to a proposed deal that heavily favors Russia. European leaders, confronted with a fait accompli, are striving to support Volodymyr Zelensky and put forward counterproposals.
byline: By Claire Gatinois (Johannesburg (South Africa), special correspondent) and Piotr Smolar (Washington (United States) correspondent)

title: American evangelicals' new offensive in Africa
subhead: The American Christian right, supported by MAGA's evangelical networks, is expanding its influence in Africa, advancing an ultra-conservative agenda and furthering the ambitions of Donald Trump.

Nicolas Guillou, French ICC judge sanctioned by the US: 'You are effectively blacklisted by much of the world's banking system'
subhead: Six judges and three prosecutors at the International Criminal Court have been sanctioned by the Trump administration. In an interview with Le Monde, Guillou discusses the impact of these measures on his work and daily life.
byline: Interview by Stéphanie Maupas (The Hague (Netherlands) correspondent)

title: Fluctuating pay, seasonal work: Welcome to China's 'iPhone City'
subhead: Foxconn's production lines, driven by Apple's marketing strategy, need workers only for part of the year. Still, many are drawn to the overtime pay and bonuses.

title: 'He looked me up and down': Hostesses, flight attendants and waitresses speak out about everyday sexualization
subhead: Crude jokes, inappropriate stares and overt flirting are commonplace for women in service jobs where physical appearance is paramount. Employees remain poorly protected from this sexualization, which can amount to harassment.
